title: Rotational kinematics omega graph for bike wheel

content.description: A bicycle wheel is rotating on a stationary test stand when a bicycle mechanic starts applying the wheel’s brake at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The graph shows the angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> of the wheel as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> while the brake is being applied. Which of the following is true about the angular displacement and angular acceleration of the wheel during the time interval shown?
content.question: Angular DisplacementAngular AccelerationAIncreasing at a decreasing rateNegative and increasing in magnitudeBIncreasing at a decreasing rateMaximum at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and decreasing to zeroCNegative and increasing in magnitudeNegative and increasing in magnitudeDNegative and increasing in magnitudeMaximum at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and decreasing to zero

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
